title: Council Directive 76/462/EEC of 4 May 1976 amending for the eleventh time Directive 64/54/EEC on the approximation of the laws of the Member States concerning the preservatives authorized for use in foodstuffs intended for human consumption
header:
COUNCIL DIRECTIVE  of 4 May 1976  amending for the eleventh time Directive 64/54/EEC on the approximation of the laws of the Member States concerning the preservatives authorized for use in foodstuffs intended for human consumption  (76/462/EEC)
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Article 7 (a) of Directive 64/54/EEC shall be replaced by the following:  (1)OJ No C 257, 10.11.1975, p. 41. (2)OJ No C 35, 16.2.1976, p. 25. (3)OJ No 12, 27.1.1964, p. 161/64. (4)OJ No L 208, 30.7.1974, p. 25. (5)OJ No L 189, 12.7.1974, p. 1.
"(a) The following general criteria of purity:    - they shall not contain a toxicologically dangerous amount of any element, in particular heavy metals,
- they shall not contain more than 3 mg/kg of arsenic or more than 10 mg/kg of lead,
- they shall not contain more than 50 mg/kg of copper and zinc taken together of which the zinc content must in no case exceed 25 mg/kg, subject to any exception deriving from the specific criteria of purity referred to in (b);"
Part I of the Annex to Directive 64/54/EEC shall be supplemented as follows: >PIC FILE= "T0009168">
Part II of the Annex to Directive 64/54/EEC shall be supplemented as follows: >PIC FILE= "T0009169">

1. Member States shall bring into force not later than 12 months after notification of this Directive the laws, regulations or administrative provisions necessary to comply with this Directive and shall forthwith inform the Commission thereof.
2. Member States shall nevertheless be allowed until 1 January 1979 at the latest to bring into force the provisions of Article 3 relating to potassium nitrite (E 249).
This Directive is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 4 May 1976.
For the Council
The President
G. THORN
